definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: The man came after the boy waving a big stick .
sentences.chinese: 那个男人扬着一根大棒去追赶小男孩。

sentences.english: As soon as the boys entered the field the farmer come after them waving a big stick.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一进入农田，那农场主就挥舞着大棒追了过来。

sentences.english: The farmer came after the intruders with a big stick .
sentences.chinese: 农夫拿着大棒追赶闯进来的人。

sentences.english: Lately, China has been showing the business world the business end of its economic cudgel.
sentences.chinese: 最近中国就在向商界展示其经济大棒的商业端。

sentences.english: The farmer come after the intruder with a big stick.
sentences.chinese: 农夫拿著大棒追赶闯进来的人。

sentences.english: China’s Haier is a market leader in the vigorous use of sticks and carrots.
sentences.chinese: 中国的海尔是巧妙的运用大棒加罗卜政策的行业典范。

sentences.english: Carrots are more corrupting than sticks .
sentences.chinese: 胡萝卜比大棒更令人心醉。

sentences.english: Employers should put down carrots and start brandishing sticks.
sentences.chinese: 雇主应该放下“萝卜”，转而挥舞“大棒”。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
pitchfork/garden fork/restraining pole (used by police)/military fork (of ancient times)
